question: Which Indian chessmaster has clinched the 33rd Reykjavik Open Chess Tournament 2018?
explanation: Baskaran Adhiban from India has clinched the title in the 33rd Reykjavik Open Chess Tournament 2018 with an impressive performance that saw him win five of the nine games. He became only the second Indian after Abhijeet Gupta (in 2016) to win the prestigious Reykjavik Open.
